name: Eugene O'Neill Quiz | Eugene O'Neill | 10 Questions

questions.text: O'Neill's father earned a considerable reputation for himself. In what field?
questions.explanation:
Acting.

	James O'Neill made a fine living portraying the Count of Monte Cristo. He felt, however, that he had compromised himself artistically by 'selling out' for commercial success.

questions.text: O'Neill had three wives. Which of the following was NOT one of them?
questions.explanation:
Oona.

	Kathleen was the {first;} that marriage was brief. Then cames Agnes, then Carlotta. Oona was his daughter.

questions.text: O'Neill's daughter married a famous 'older man'. In what field did this man earn his reputation?
questions.explanation:
Entertainment.

	Oona, his only daughter, married Charlie Chaplin. Eugene Junior committed suicide. His other son, Shane, experienced many problems - mostly with substance abuse.

questions.text: O'Neill spent some time in a sanitarium recuperating from a serious illness. What was it?
questions.explanation:
Tuberculosis.

	The plot of 'Long Day's Journey' dramatizes this illness (among other problems).

questions.text: One of O'Neill's best known work is 'The Iceman Cometh'. What does the 'iceman' represent?
questions.explanation:
Death.

	The role of Hickey is a choice one for actors.

questions.text: O'Neill was very proud of his work experiences prior to becoming a writer. What work did he do?
questions.explanation:
Seaman.

	He was an able bodied seaman. Many of his plays are set at sea.

questions.text: Which of O'Neill's plays was not produced until after his death?
questions.explanation:
Long Day's Journey.

	'Long Day's Journey' was autobiographical. It was not produced until after his death (at his own request).

questions.text: Which play was written by O'Neill as a remembrance of his brother?
questions.explanation:
A Moon for the Misbegotten.

	Poor Jamie didn't do too well in life: O'Neill's older brother drank himself to death, more or less.

questions.text: Uncharacteristically, O'Neill wrote this light-hearted piece.
questions.explanation:
Ah, Wilderness.

	It's a look at the happy-go-lucky youth that he might have wanted - but did not have.

questions.text: 'Strange Interlude' is one of O'Neill's best known works. What distinctive feature does it contain?
options: The use of music for dramaqtic effect
questions.explanation:
The actors speak their thoughts.

	The actors express their thoughts in dramatic 'asides'. Masks were used in 'The Great God {Brown';} drums were used for effect in 'The Emperor Jones'. Dialect was used in 'All God's Chillun Got Wings'.
